examples: to his lands Henry added the property of several landowners attainted in the course of his reign

verb.description: Affect or infect with disease or corruption.
examples: even to have kicked an outsider might have been held to attaint the foot

origin: Middle English (in the sense touch, reach, attain): from obsolete attaint (adjective), from Old French ataint, ateint, past participle of ateindre bring to justice (see attain); influenced in meaning by taint.
